intro: Onopordum minus, commonly known as tansy or lesser hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and alternate leaves with a rough texture. The plant produces yellow flowers in dense clusters, which bloom from late summer to early autumn. Its roots are fibrous and its leaves are often used in traditional herbal medicine. Onopordum minus is also known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural settings.
